title: Stop producing GPU overrides explain for auxiliary SQL operations
body:
Users may be confused by a CPU fallback that is harmless and expected for SQL auxiliary statements

Repro:

Start spark-sql
```bash
~/dist/spark-3.1.3-bin-hadoop3.2/bin/spark-sql  --jars rapids-4-spark_2.12-23.06.0-cuda11.jar --conf spark.plugins=com.nvidia.spark.SQLPlugin
```

Execute an [auxiliary statement](https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/sql-ref-syntax.html#auxiliary-statements) like ADD JAR or SET. It probably affects more categories of non-query statements.

```SQL
spark-sql> SET MSG = 'Just logging something';
23/09/07 17:52:33 WARN GpuOverrides: 
! <LocalTableScanExec> cannot run on GPU because GPU does not currently support the operator class org.apache.spark.sql.execution.LocalTableScanExec
  @Expression <AttributeReference> key#20 could run on GPU
  @Expression <AttributeReference> value#21 could run on GPU

MSG	'Just logging something'
Time taken: 0.021 seconds, Fetched 1 row(s)

spark-sql> ADD JAR /some/path/file.jar';
Added [/some/path/file.jar] to class path
Added resources: [/some/path/file.jar']
23/09/07 18:02:54 WARN GpuOverrides: 
! <LocalTableScanExec> cannot run on GPU because GPU does not currently support the operator class org.apache.spark.sql.execution.LocalTableScanExec
  @Expression <AttributeReference> result#0 could run on GPU

Time taken: 1.139 seconds
```

The reason is that these auxiliary statements still have a physical plan 
```
== Physical Plan ==
LocalTableScan (1)


(1) LocalTableScan
Output [1]: [result#10]
Arguments: <empty>, [result#10]
```
